articles.author: Helen Reid, Benjamin Mallet, Sybille Hamaide
articles.description: Lady Gaga sang a French cabaret song near Notre-Dame cathedral, a giant plume of blue, white and red smoke was sent high above a bridge over the Seine and a winged man played accordion as the Olympics' opening ceremony got under way in Paris on Friday.
articles.title: Lady Gaga brings cabaret to Paris opening ceremony on the Seine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Alleged Mexican kingpin Ismael El Mayo Zambada has pleaded not guilty to U.S. drug trafficking charges, court records showed on Friday, after he and a son of another drug lord were arrested on Thursday in El Paso, Texas.
articles.title: Mexican drug kingpin Ismael 'El Mayo' Zambada pleads not guilty to US charges

articles.author: Martin Petty
articles.description: Australia's foreign minister urged Myanmar's military rulers on Saturday to take a different path and end an intensifying civil war, as top diplomats of world powers gathered in Laos ahead of two summits seeking to tackle key global issues.
articles.title: Australia's Wong presses Myanmar generals to change tack ahead of Laos summits

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi has warned the Philippines over the U.S. intermediate-range missile deployment, saying such a move could fuel regional tensions and spark an arms race.
articles.title: China's foreign minister warns Philippines over US missile deployment

articles.author: Jeff Mason, Jarrett Renshaw
articles.description: The endorsement could help activate and sustain energy and fundraising for Harris’ campaign.
articles.title: Trump vows return to site of assassination attempt, Obamas endorse Harris

articles.author: Dominique Vidalon, Elizabeth Pineau
articles.description: Vandals targeted France's high-speed train network with a series of coordinated actions that brought major disruption to some of the country's busiest rail lines ahead of the Paris Olympics opening ceremony on Friday.
articles.title: Arsonists attack French railways hours before Olympic ceremony

articles.author: Tom Balmforth
articles.description: Russia has begun including new, cheaply-made drones in its long-range attacks on Ukraine, to try to identify air defences, film any damage and act as decoys, a Ukrainian military spy official said.
articles.title: Exclusive: Russia deploys cheap drones to locate Ukraine's air defences

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: CIA Director William Burns will meet this weekend in Rome with his Israeli and Egyptian counterparts and Qatar's prime minister for talks on a Gaza ceasefire and the release of hostages by Hamas, a source familiar with the matter said on Friday.
articles.title: CIA chief to meet Israeli, Qatari and Egyptian officials for Gaza talks, source says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un said it was a sacred mission of the current generation to build a "paradise for the people" based on the ideology defended by a previous generation of victors with their blood as the country marked the Korean War anniversary on Saturday.
articles.title: North Korea's Kim calls for 'people's paradise' marking Korean War 'Victory Day'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Philippines on Saturday completed unimpeded a resupply trip to its troops at a disputed South China Sea shoal, its foreign ministry said, the first such mission under a new arrangement with China aimed at cooling tensions.
articles.title: Philippines completes first South China Sea resupply mission since deal with Beijing
